Class Crop

java.lang.Object
Crop
public class Crop extends Object
This class represents a crop, that has a name, waterAmt where it stores the current amount of water, minWater where it stores the minimum amount of water needs for crop to survive, maxWater where it stores the maximum amount of water the crop can receive, fertilizerAmt where it stores the current amount of fertilizer, minFertilizer where it stores the minimum amount fertilizer needs for the crop to survive, maxFertilizer where it stores the maximum amount of fertilizer the crop can receive, daysPlanted where it stores the number of days the crop is currently planted, daysUntilHarvest where it stores the number of days the crop needs to be ready to harvest, minProduct where it stores the minimum amount of product the crop can produce, maxProduct where it stores the maximum amount of product the crop can produce, baseSellPrice where it stores the crop's base selling price, expGain where it stores the amount of experience that the player can gain harvesting the crop, cropCost where it stores the cost to plant the crop.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Crop(String name, int minWater, int maxWater, int minFertilizer, int maxFertilizer, int daysUntilHarvest, int minProduct, int maxProduct, int baseSellPrice, double expGain, int cropCost)
    Creates a Crop object by supplying the name, minWater, maxWater, minFertilizer, maxFertilizer, daysUntilHarvest, minProduct, maxProduct, baseSellPrice, expGain, and cropCost.

  • Constructor Details

    • Crop

      public Crop(String name, int minWater, int maxWater, int minFertilizer, int maxFertilizer, int daysUntilHarvest, int minProduct, int maxProduct, int baseSellPrice, double expGain, int cropCost)
      Creates a Crop object by supplying the name, minWater, maxWater, minFertilizer, maxFertilizer, daysUntilHarvest, minProduct, maxProduct, baseSellPrice, expGain, and cropCost. This constructor also initializes the waterAmt, fertilizerAmt, and daysPlanted to 0.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the crop
      minWater - minimum amount of water for the crop to survive
      maxWater - maximum amount of water the crop can receive
      minFertilizer - minimum amount of fertilizer for the crop to survive
      maxFertilizer - maximum amount of fertilizer the crop can receive
      daysUntilHarvest - number of days until the crop is ready to be harvested
      minProduct - minimum amount of product the crop can produce
      maxProduct - maximum amount of product the crop can produce
      baseSellPrice - base sell price of the crop
      expGain - amount of experience that will be gained by harvesting the crop
      cropCost - cost to plant the crop

    • waterCrop

      public void waterCrop(int waterBonusIncrease)
      This method adds 1 to the amount of water the crop currently has. It won't add more water if it has reach the max amount of water the crop can take.
      Parameters:
      waterBonusIncrease - bonus amount of water the crop can take based on farmer type

    • fertilizeCrop

      public void fertilizeCrop(int fertilizerBonusIncrease)
      This method adds 1 to the amount of fertilizer the crop currently has. It won't add more fertilizer if it has reach the max amount of fertilizer the crop can take.
      Parameters:
      fertilizerBonusIncrease - bonus amount of fertilizer the crop can take based on farmer type

    • addDay

      public void addDay()
      This method adds 1 day to the current amount of days the crop is planted for.

    • harvestAmt

      public int harvestAmt()
      This method randomly generates a harvest amount for when the player harvests the crop based on the minimum amount of product and maximum amount of product the crop can produce.
      Returns:
      random harvest amount

    • isReady

      public boolean isReady()
      This method checks if the crop has achieved it requirements to be ready to be harvested
      Returns:
      true if the crop is ready to be harvested and false if otherwise

    • isWithered

      public boolean isWithered()
      This method checks if the crop has withered or not
      Returns:
      true if the plant has withered and false if otherwise
